title: Better support for common const generic errors in item definition

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-suggestion-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: suggestions generated by the compiler applied by cargo fix

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

body:
Given

```rust
struct A<const N: u8>;
impl<N> Display for A<N> {}
```

[we currently emit](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=601e51cff8fc9e780c74d829f7f63f13)

```
error[E0747]: type provided when a constant was expected
 --> src/lib.rs:4:23
  |
4 | impl<N> Display for A<N> {}
  |                       ^
  |
help: if this generic argument was intended as a const parameter, try surrounding it with braces:
  |
4 | impl<N> Display for A<{ N }> {}
  |                       ^   ^
```

[if we follow the suggestion, it will emit](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=8dd7dbc09e6b3879bca992c432c550c4):

```
error[E0423]: expected value, found type parameter `N`
 --> src/lib.rs:4:25
  |
2 | struct A<const N: u8>;
  | ---------------------- similarly named unit struct `A` defined here
3 | 
4 | impl<N> Display for A<{ N }> {}
  |                         ^ help: a unit struct with a similar name exists: `A`

error[E0207]: the type parameter `N` is not constrained by the impl trait, self type, or predicates
 --> src/lib.rs:4:6
  |
4 | impl<N> Display for A<{ N }> {}
  |      ^ unconstrained type parameter
```

The [correct code would have been](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=3ac28a8898599a280c327bcf2bdf57da):

```rust
struct A<const N: u8>;

impl<const N: u8> Display for A<N> {
```

[Another potential mistake is](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=4543a8156e2bc20d265afd384a6279aa)

```rust
impl Display for A<N> {
```
```
error[E0412]: cannot find type `N` in this scope
 --> src/lib.rs:4:20
  |
2 | struct A<const N: u8>;
  | ---------------------- similarly named struct `A` defined here
3 | 
4 | impl Display for A<N> {
  |                    ^ help: a struct with a similar name exists: `A`

error[E0747]: type provided when a constant was expected
 --> src/lib.rs:4:20
  |
4 | impl Display for A<N> {
  |                    ^
  |
help: if this generic argument was intended as a const parameter, try surrounding it with braces:
  |
4 | impl Display for A<{ N }> {
  |                    ^   ^
```

We should handle at least these three cases and actually suggest the right code.
